statement.p:
Consider the differential equation \frac{dy}{dt} = 3y - 1 with initial value y(0) = 2.
Find the exact solution of the initial value problem.
Use Euler's method with step size h = 0.5 to approximate the solution to the initial value problem on the interval [0,2] Your solution should include a table of approximate values of the dependent variable as well as the exact values of the dependent variable. Make sure that your approximations are accurate to four decimal places.
Sketch the graph of the approximate and exact solutions.
Use the error bound theorem (Theorem ) to estimate the error at each approximation. Your solution should include a table of approximate values of the dependent variable the exact values of the dependent variable, the error estimates, and the actual error. Make sure that your approximations are accurate to four decimal places.

In this series of exercises, we will prove the error bound theorem for Euler's method (Theorem ).
Use Taylor's Theorem to show that for all x \geq -1 and any positive m, 0 \leq (1 + x)^m \leq e^{mx}.
Use part (1) and geometric series to prove the following statement: If s and t are positive real numbers, and \{ a_i \}_{i = 0}^k is a sequence satisfying
a_0 & \geq -\frac{t}{s} a_{i+1} & \leq (1 + s) a_i + t, \text{ for }i = 0, 1, 2, \ldots, k,
then a_{i + 1} \leq e^{(i + 1)s} \left( \frac{t}{s} + a_0 \right) - \frac{t}{s}.
When i = 0, y(t_0) = Y_0 = \alpha and the theorem is true. Use Euler's method and Taylor's Theorem to show that |y_{i + 1} - Y_{i + 1} | \leq |y_i - Y_i| + h |f(t_i, y_i) - f(t_i, Y_i)| + \frac{h^2}{2} |y''(\xi_i)| where \xi_i \in (t_i, t_{i+1}) and y_k = y(t_k).
Show that |y_{i + 1} - Y_{i + 1} | \leq |y_i - Y_i| (1 + hL) + \frac{Mh^2}{2}.
Let a_j = |y_j - Y_j| for j = 0, 1, \ldots, N, s = hL, and t = M h^2/2 and apply part (2) to show |y_{i + 1} - Y_{i + 1} | \leq e^{(1 + i)hL} \left( |y_0 - Y_0| + \frac{M h^2 }{2hL} \right) - \frac{M h^2}{2hL}. and derive that |y_{i + 1} - Y_{i + 1} | \leq \frac{M h }{2L} \left( e^{(t_{i+ 1} - a)L} - 1\right) for each i = 0, 1, \ldots, N-1.

hint.p:
Hints for part (2):
For fixed i show that
a_{i + 1} & \leq (1 + s)a_i + t & \leq (1 + s)[(1 + s)a_{i - 1}+ t] + t & \leq (1 + s)\{ (1 + s)[(1 + s) a_{i - 2} + t]+ t\} + t & \vdots & \leq (1 + s)^{i+1}a_0 + [1 + (1 + s) + (1+s)^2 + \cdots + (1 + s)^i]t.
Now use a geometric sum to show that a_{i + 1} \leq (1 + s)^{i + 1} a_0 + \frac{t}{s}[(1 + s)^{i + 1} - 1] = (1 + s)^{i + 1} \left( \frac{t}{s} + a_0 \right) - \frac{t}{s}.
Apply part (1) to derive a_{i + 1} \leq e^{(i + 1)s} \left( \frac{t}{s} + a_0 \right) - \frac{t}{s}.
